steps.text: Identify potential fire risks in working machines.
Evaluate each machine's operating environment.
Issue clear instructions for safety.
Supervise compliance with safety instructions.
Inspect and clean engine compartment at least once a week.
Clean with compressed air after shift.
Inspect for leaks after cleaning.
Visually inspect electrical systems at least once a year.
Service electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines.
Use multimeter to measure voltage drops.
Use thermal imaging camera to detect anomalies.
Check emergency kill switch before starting the machine.
Repair any malfunction that required its use.
Inspect battery.
Repair any deviations in battery.
Ensure cable terminals are intact and attached.
Protect cables with terminal covers.
Check electric panel.
Repair any redundant or hanging wires.
Check attachment of cables in high-vibration engine compartment.
Inspect alternator.
Check fasteners, belts, and bearings in alternator.
Inspect exhaust pipe for leaks.
Ensure all thermal shields are in place.
Check ammable liquid hoses are not too close.
Ensure safe environment for diesel particulate filter regeneration.
Inspect swivelling joint hoses and electrical systems weekly.
Ensure all operating manuals are available and understandable.
Check auxiliary heater cleanliness and condition before winter.
Test hand-held fire extinguishers under supervision.
Ensure machines in dust or fire hazard environments have a fixed, fully automatic fire extinguishing system.
Provide at least three litres of extinguishing agent for each cubic meter of the engine or heater compartment.
Install detection system covering entire engine compartment and connect to non-fused cables.
Obtain installation certificate and compliance test report.
Confirm system operation at start-up and repair any malfunctions.
Service the system at least once a year.
Clean engine compartments daily in hazardous environments.
Check signs and markings.
Inspect machine electrical systems (battery cables, harnesses, main power switch, alternator).
Examine engine mechanics (fuel/oil/hydraulic lines, exhaust system).
Inspect first-aid extinguishing equipment (hand-held extinguishers, system log).
Check auxiliary heater (installation, fuel manifold, exhaust, electrical system).
Inspect mains power systems.
Assess general condition and cleanliness.
Repair any malfunctions that could lead to an accident without delay.
Arrange practical training on accident and fire procedures.
Check cables and fasteners for security, heat resistance, insulation, and lead-throughs.
Inspect the condition of non-fused cables and terminal covers in fuses and batteries.
Clean engine and heater compartments.
Check the availability, markings, and operator training for first-aid extinguishing equipment.
Identify the company name: Pohjola Insurance Ltd.
Determine the business ID: 1458359-3.
Locate the company address: Helsinki, Gebhardinaukio 1, 00013 OP, Finland.
Identify the domicile: Helsinki.
Determine the regulatory authority: Financial Supervisory Authority, www.fiva.fi.

constraints.text: Working machines must be evaluated for fire risks based on their operating conditions and environment.
Shut down engine before inspecting for fuel leaks.
Protect hydraulic hoses from high temperatures.
Inspect electrical systems annually and document inspections.
Service electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines.
Do not use emergency kill switch for normal shutdown.
Ensure sufficient ventilation in battery compartment.
Replace cables showing signs of abrasion or heat damage.
Fasteners and cable ties should withstand temperatures of 120°C.
Do not attach cables to pipes or hoses containing flammable material.
Ensure regeneration occurs in a safe outdoor environment away from flammable materials.
Delay regeneration if machine is in a fire-hazard environment.
Never leave machine unattended during regeneration.
Machines > 3,000 kg must have at least two hand-held fire extinguishers.
Machines for crushing timber or energy waste need four hand-held fire extinguishers.
Machines in dust or fire hazard environments must have a fixed, fully automatic fire extinguishing system.
Provide at least three litres of extinguishing agent for each cubic meter of the engine or heater compartment.
Install detection system covering entire engine compartment and connect to non-fused cables.
Obtain installation certificate and compliance test report.
Confirm system operation at start-up and repair any malfunctions.
Service the system at least once a year.
Clean engine compartments daily in hazardous environments.
Perform inspections in the order listed.
